title.narrative: 3.3. MOE MONITORING NETWORKS

description.narrative: Enhanced capacity of MoE to use performance monitoring networks, management and support mechanisms to guarantee positive, culturally relevant, inclusive and gender sensitive learning experiences in schools and develop resilient communities in targeted areas., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2019, boys and girls, especially from rural indigenous communities, will access and complete preschool and primary and will have more opportunities to complete secondary education.

sector.narrative: System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary standards and governance
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.
System strengthening - mother tongue / multilingual education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enhanced capacity of MoE to use performance monitoring networks, management and support mechanisms to guarantee positive,culturally relevant, inclusive and gender sensitive learning experiences in schools and develop resilient communities in targetedareas.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the MOE in the organization of community ;and technical networks, enabling scale-up of ECD programs and alternative education for OOSC&A. Networks were organized around neighboring communities increasing their sense of belonging and helping to promote the use of mother tongue instruction and culturally pertinent learning experiences. The networks helped monitor MoE strategies, performance indicators, promoted education opportunities and pathways for school return.UNICEF supported monitoring networks to address bottlenecks by engaging with school management committees and teachers to identify solutions and actions for COVID-19 and emergencies. Networks enabled better coordination to build positive, relevant, and inclusive education experiences.;;;;;;;;;;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/01/2022
